caption: Algorithm 2: Dynamic regret OLO through 1-dimensional reduction [9]
description: This algorithm uses a 1-dimensional parameter-free online learning algorithm and embeds the comparator sequence into a higher-dimensional space to achieve dynamic regret guarantees. It iteratively updates its prediction by considering the current loss, a positive definite symmetric matrix M, and a scale-free FTRL update. The algorithm dynamically adjusts its step size and prediction based on the accumulated loss and variance.
section: 4 Dynamic regret for unconstrained OLO via weighted norms
